Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Canuckonthecoast
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the years. The staff have always been helpful and polite. The room is basic, the water not always hot early in the morning, but the food is good and taxis safe. The security guys watch things and there are some nice shops nearby. There is a great tourist market on Rue Londras "London St." where you can haggle over the prices...you should as they don't expect you to pay the price they ask at first. I have been in many hotels in the city over the years, but find this one bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Justin S
Reviews.Content: I had booked three rooms for a convention in Mexico City. When we arrived the rooms smelled horrible. Ended up changing rooms but as the day continued our "new" rooms started to smell worse and worse like sewage. A/C didn't work, safe deposit box originally did not work as well as one of their two elevators for a 13 story hotel did not work which we were told never works when it rains. It rained every day of our stay. One night around midnight while sleeping someone opened my door but luckily I had the security lock so that person could not come in. The front desk had given a key to my room by mistake to another guest. The list goes on and on. definitely avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “its, ok.”
Reviews.Author: tripnexus
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I would have to say it was ok. The hotel lobby is nice, restaurant was actually very good. But, the beds in the rooms were terrible, hard, and they had no comforters. Our first room had to be changed, apparently the door interlocking the rooms had no lock! Our second room's window was broken and did not close all the way. But, the staff was helpful and it was not noisy at night. If you do not mind hard hard beds, I suggest it. In walking distance to some sight seeing. A convenience store is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good option”
Reviews.Author: TimeTravellerMX
Reviews.Content: Close to downtown and great business this hotel is a great & cheaper option if you have meetings nearby. Also, there are great restaurants surrounding an very good security.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: sdbeachhomes
Reviews.Content: this place is clean and not a bad value at around $75 us. lodging is pricey in DF. So I was happy with this one. only complaint was the fire alarm in my room has flashing red and green lights all night. stupid. I am bringing some tape to cover it up when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation but clean, comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: UkFil_
Reviews.Content: Basic accomodation but clean, comfortable and in a fairly good location ; the metro was easy walking distance. There was also a good taco stand across the road! Ask for a room above the first couple of floors though as the road and air con units were a bit noisy in the morning

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was 5Star...”
Reviews.Author: MongolGlobal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Good location, nice breakfast, friendly staff. I didn't book the hotel cause I was traveling for work and this hotel was booked last minute because of a change of our schedule but I was very pleasantly surprised. I had just come from Acalpulco so this was like a lux 5 star. Haha ok a little bit of an exaggeration, but I honestly I didn't know if it was 5 star or 4 star. I couldn't find any fault with the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PaloSolo
Reviews.Content: I had the best time in Mexico City. The hotel Casa Inn is very well located, just a block from Reforma, great affordable restaurants all around it, free internet, great breakfast buffet, close to most historic sites. Right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Never again unless they get new beds.”
Reviews.Author: luvwarmH2O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a whole week.. Staff was great very friendly, breakfast was included with our stay it was fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee and orange juice for 5 more dollars you can get the full breakfast. Which we did a couple of times. Food was great. Hotel is very nice, modern, close to everything. About 10mins form the park and museum. Our biggest complaint about this hotel was the NOISE and the BEDS. they just remodeled and claim they put double pane windows. But if you decide to stay here take EAR Plugs, you can hear all honking and traffic. I travel to Mexico every year, but these beds were the worst beds EVER. It was like sleeping on concrete slabs. We were waking up in the morning with sore backs and necks. It was 50 degrees at night the rooms do not have heating but the hall ways do. we were freezing at night. DO NOT stay here. Not worth it. You will tired and not be able to fully enjoy Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It Brand New”
Reviews.Author: Felix-7
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to everything. Staff was great and it is brand new. Hotel is soundproof, I got free internet, restaurant was decicious. I recomend it over more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: LasCruces_NM
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears to have undergone a recent renovation. The rooms were fresh and clean and the beds were comfortable. There is a plasma television, free wifi internet, a security safe, and a nice, clean bathroom. The climate controls worked perfectly and the hotel was quiet. I especially like the location, one block from the Paseo de la Reforma, and the proximity of many good eateries. I had some great "enchiladas de mole" on Rio Lerma just across Rio Mississippi. I will stay here again! -dgh

Reviews.Title: “the worst of our stay”
Reviews.Author: pedirto
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel in DF was in the NH Centro Historico, which obviously was a very nice hotel. After coming back to DF from San Miguel de Allende, we decided to stay at Casa Inn. The room needed cleaning, the walls were kind of dirty, the carpet dirty too, and a few of the bathroom's tiles were broken. The overall quality of the room was very low. Since I had to leave at 6am, the lady in charge of the breakfast told me that I would get a bag with some cakes before departing as my breakfast was included with my room. The morning that I had to leave I went down to the front desk at 5:30am but the person there told me that he had not been informed about providing any breakfast for my room. I just could not believe that I had paid for my breakfast and the manager just let me go without it. I told them to call me a cab to go to the airport and they got me a private SUV. I told the driver that I just needed a regular cab, which usually charges you around $35 from that area to the airport (I had done it before). He said that a regular taxi would charge me around $180. Since I had to rush to take my flight, I had to pay him $150 for the ride. I was ripped off, and the hotel was responsible for getting me this kind of transportation. Pick another hotel if you can, they are irresponsible and incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but slow service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cassa Inn.. the room was nice..nice big tv, however, no one informed us that there was a need for a deposit for a remote...went down, gave the deposit..the control didn't work. Called the front desk and was told that someone would bring one shortly...no one came. Next day, someone came with the wrong control. Turns out they didn't have any controls for that TV brand. Was told they would change our TV, than told they couldn't do that. So paid a deposit for no remote control. Room service worst than that. When it didn't take an hour to get our food, they gave it to another room. There was no kettle or coffee maker in the room...so had to go without it. Their carpets need cleaning. Towards the end of our stay we decided against complaining anymore since they were so slow to respond. However, no complains about the location. We loved that we could walk to the Zona Rosa. The area is very nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Casa Inn was ok for the money. The restaurant in fine, as well as the lower level. The rooms have very uncomfortable beds. The mattress sits on top of a slab of wood, no box spring underneath. Our toilet overflowed at 1 am for no apparent reason. The staff refused to help us clean up. We were told that the maids would not be in until the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Casa Inn is fabulous - great location at a reasonable rate (walking distance to Zona Rosa and the angel statue). Breakfast and lunch buffets are great - very friendly and attentive staff. Internet in the downstairs lobby. Rooms are standard size and the bathroom/shower are very spacious. The check-in desk can be a little intimidating b/c not everyone speaks English, but in general they are pretty patient with travelers. I would definitely recommend the Inn.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Inn Mexico City
HotelInfo.Address: Rio Lerma 237 esquina Rio Mississippi | Col. Cuauhtemoc, Mexico City 06500, Mexico
